revised_title: Vibrational Spectra of Diatomic Chains: A New Mathematical Approach
tldr: The authors used a new mathematical technique to obtain quantitatively accurate results for the vibrational spectra of disordered diatomic chains. The spectra show complex features, including an array of peaks and valleys, which provide insights into the behavior of three-dimensional lattices. The method is suitable for use on high-speed digital computers and can be applied to study the effect of variation in order on the vibrational spectra of different types of chains.
